definitions.definition: Not paid for.
definitions.example: an unpaid bill

definitions.definition: Of work: done without agreed payment, usually voluntarily.
definitions.example: an unpaid position

definitions.definition: One of a series of parts, whether equal or unequal to the other parts of the series, of a given entity or a given process, which part presents or is presented at a particular scheduled interval.

One member of a series of portions of a debt or sum of money, which portions may or may not be equated (depending in part on whether the interest rate is fixed or variable), payment of which portions are serially exacted at regularly scheduled intervals toward satisfaction of the total. Payments of installments are generally mensual, quarterly, triannual, biannual, or annual.
A part of a published or broadcast serial.
The act of installing; installation.
The seat in which one is placed.
Pertaining to the asp or aspen tree.
Tremulous, trembling.
Of a woman's tongue: wagging, gossiping.
The asp tree; a kind of poplar tree (genus Populus sect. Populus). A medium-size tree with thin, straight trunks of a greenish-white color.
definitions.example: Above a certain elevation, the aspens gave way to scrubby, gnarled pines.

definitions.definition: The wood of such a tree; usually pale, lightweight and soft.
definitions.example: She claimed that aspen was the only "proper" material from which make a wicker basket.

definitions.definition: (law enforcement) An armed, undercover guard on a commercial-airline flight.
A military rank in fiction for air force, space force, or armed forces, usually the topmost rank
To take part in a teleconference.
definitions.example: I teleconferenced with marketing and engineering.

definitions.definition: The holding of teleconferences

A plant of the genus Plantago, with a rosette of sessile leaves about 10 cm long with a narrow part instead of a petiole, and with a spike inflorescence with the flower spacing varying widely among the species. See also psyllium.
A plant in the genus Musa, the genus that includes banana, but with lower sugar content than banana.
The fruit of the plant, usually cooked before eating and used like potatoes.
A long punt.
A loop of material, typically reinforced rubber with a trapezoidal cross-section, by which a motor or engine turns a fan so that it can cool itself.
Panel of a car which encloses the wheel area, especially the front wheels
A shield, usually of plastic or metal, on a bicycle that protects the rider from mud or water

Any shaped cushion-like object normally made from polymers, rubber or wood that is placed along the sides of a boat to prevent damage when moored alongside another vessel or jetty, or when using a lock, etc. Modern variations are cylindrical although older wooden version and rubbing strips can still be found; old tyres are used as a cheap substitute
A low metal framework in front of a fireplace, intended to catch hot coals, soot, and ash
To use fenders to protect the side of a boat
A musical synthesizer.
To play on a musical synthesizer.
A law enforcement officer who supervises offenders who have been released from incarceration and, often, recommends sentencing in courts of law.
The art or science of innovation and risk-taking for profit in business.
The quality of being an entrepreneur.
To cover something with paving slabs.
To cover with stone, concrete, blacktop or other solid covering, especially to aid travel.
To pave the way for; to make easy and smooth.
The hard durable surface placed directly atop the ground, as on a street or sidewalk.
Interior pavement, as in a cathedral.
Pertaining to the material used for pavement, or to the surface itself.
Showing regard or thought for others; especially, displaying good manners or etiquette.
definitions.example: a courteous gentleman   a courteous gesture

definitions.definition: Marked by low quality; inferior; inadequate.
Raunchy or perverted in nature; tastelessly sexual
Untrustworthy
Thin and flimsy
A temple dedicated to all the gods.
All the gods of a particular people or religion, particularly the ancient Greek gods residing on Olympus, considered as a group.
(by extension) A category or classification denoting the most honored persons of a group.
A severe and rapid systemic allergic reaction to an allergen, constricting the trachea and generalized vasodilation.
To move on the feet by alternately setting each foot (or pair or group of feet, in the case of animals with four or more feet) forward, with at least one foot on the ground at all times. Compare run.
definitions.example: To walk briskly for an hour every day is to keep fit.

definitions.definition: To "walk free", i.e. to win, or avoid, a criminal court case, particularly when actually guilty.
definitions.example: If you can’t present a better case, that robber is going to walk.

definitions.definition: Of an object, to go missing or be stolen.
definitions.example: If you leave your wallet lying around, it’s going to walk.

definitions.definition: (of a batsman) To walk off the field, as if given out, after the fielding side appeals and before the umpire has ruled; done as a matter of sportsmanship when the batsman believes he is out.
To travel (a distance) by walking.
definitions.example: I walk two miles to school every day.  The museum’s not far from here – you can walk it.

definitions.definition: To take for a walk or accompany on a walk.
definitions.example: I walk the dog every morning.  Will you walk me home?

definitions.definition: To allow a batter to reach base by pitching four balls.
To move something by shifting between two positions, as if it were walking.
definitions.example: I carefully walked the ladder along the wall.

definitions.definition: To full; to beat cloth to give it the consistency of felt.
To traverse by walking (or analogous gradual movement).
definitions.example: I walked the streets aimlessly.   Debugging this computer program involved walking the heap.

definitions.definition: To operate the left and right throttles of (an aircraft) in alternation.
To leave, resign.
definitions.example: If we don't offer him more money he'll walk.

definitions.definition: To push (a vehicle) alongside oneself as one walks.
To behave; to pursue a course of life; to conduct oneself.
To be stirring; to be abroad; to go restlessly about; said of things or persons expected to remain quiet, such as a sleeping person, or the spirit of a dead person.
To be in motion; to act; to move.
To put, keep, or train (a puppy) in a walk, or training area for dogfighting.
(hotel) To move a guest to another hotel if their confirmed reservation is not available on day of check-in.
Incarnate as a human; living.
definitions.example: Elizabeth knows so many words that they call her the walking dictionary.

definitions.definition: Able to walk in spite of injury or sickness.
Characterized by or suitable for walking.
definitions.example: a walking tour

definitions.definition: Present participle of walk.
A vote made on an official form which is then sent through the post/mail.
A viper or adder, Bitis arietans, found in Southern Africa.
The formal or informal way in which a word is made to sound when spoken.
definitions.example: What is the pronunciation of "hiccough"?

definitions.definition: The way in which the words of a language are made to sound when speaking.
definitions.example: His Italian pronunciation is terrible.

definitions.definition: The act of pronouncing or uttering something.
The bone at the back of the skull.
A sculptural portrayal of a person's head and shoulders.
The breasts and upper thorax of a woman.
The downward portion of a boom and bust cycle; a recession.
A police raid or takedown of a criminal enterprise.
A disappointment.
The act of arresting someone for a crime, or raiding a suspected criminal operation.
definitions.example: a narcotics bust

definitions.definition: A failed enterprise; a bomb.
A refutation of an opening, or of a previously published analysis.
A player who fails to meet expectations.
To break.
definitions.example: I busted my cooker while trying to fix it.

definitions.definition: To arrest (someone) for a crime.
To catch (someone) in the act of doing something wrong, socially and morally inappropriate, or illegal, especially when being done in a sneaky or secretive state.
An emphatic synonym of do or get.
definitions.example: He busted huge air off that jump!

definitions.definition: To reduce in rank.
definitions.example: He busted him down to patrolman for insubordination.

definitions.definition: To undo a trade, generally an error trade, that has already been executed.
To lose all of one's chips.
To exceed a score of 21.
To break in (an animal).
To ejaculate; to eject semen.
Without any money, broke, bankrupt.
definitions.example: After months of financial problems, the company finally went bust.

definitions.definition: A gangster; a hired thug.
A rough or violent youth.
(of a disease or disease-causing agent) Highly infectious, malignant or deadly.
Hostile to the point of being venomous; intensely acrimonious.
definitions.example: The politicians were virulent in their hatred of the president.

definitions.definition: Not finished, not completed.
Of political ideologies: opposing political and social equality; especially conservative, traditional and/or reactionary politics.
The final stages of pregnancy; accouchement.
A period of postpartum confinement, typically a month or longer, formerly common in Europe and still practiced in some parts of the world.
Of, or relating to childbirth or postpartum confinement
Of a language: such that every spoken syllable takes up more or less the same amount of time.
A person who lives alone; a recluse or hermit.
A game for one person, played on a board with pegs or balls, in which the object is, beginning with all the places filled except one, to remove all but one of the pieces by "jumping", as in draughts.
Any of various card games that can be played by one person. Called patience in the rest of the world.
An extinct bird related to the dodo, Pezophaps solitaria, Rodrigues solitaire, that lived on the island of Rodrigues.
An extinct bird formerly believed to be related to the dodo, more precisely Réunion solitaire, Raphus solitarius, now preferably Réunion ibis, Threskiornis solitarius.
One of several American species of bird in the genus Myadestes in the thrush family.
A single gem, usually a diamond, mounted in a piece of jewellery by itself.
A black neck ribbon worn with a bag wig in the 18th century.
Living or being alone; solitary
An area of land that is at elevation; mountainous land.
Relating to highlands.
Fly-half
A device which maintains a fixed distance between two objects, especially between a surface and a sign or electrical wiring.
A deadlocked confrontation between antagonists (see stand off and verb below).
definitions.example: A tense standoff between demonstrators and police continued overnight.

definitions.definition: A slope; an incline, inclination.
definitions.example: The house was built on a bit of a slant and was never quite level.

definitions.definition: A sloped surface or line.
A run: a heading driven diagonally between the dip and strike of a coal seam.
An oblique movement or course.
A sloping surface in a culture medium.
A pan with a sloped bottom used for holding paintbrushes.
A container or surface bearing shallow sloping areas to hold watercolors.
A sarcastic remark; shade, an indirect mocking insult.
An opportunity, particularly to go somewhere.
A crime committed for the purpose of being apprehended and transported to a major settlement.
(originally United States) A point of view, an angle; a bias.
definitions.example: It was a well written article, but it had a bit of a leftist slant.

definitions.definition: A look, a glance.
A person with slanting eyes, particularly an East Asian.
To lean, tilt or incline.
definitions.example: If you slant the track a little more, the marble will roll down it faster.

definitions.definition: To bias or skew.
definitions.example: The group tends to slant its policies in favor of the big businesses it serves.

definitions.definition: To lie or exaggerate.
Sloping; oblique; slanted.
A slashing action or motion, particularly:
A mark made by a slashing motion, particularly:
Something resembling such a mark, particularly:
The loose woody debris remaining from a slash, (particularly forestry) the trimmings left while preparing felled trees for removal.
definitions.example: Slash generated during logging may constitute a fire hazard.

definitions.definition: Slash fiction.
A drink of something; a draft.
A piss: an act of urination.
A swampy area; a swamp.
A large quantity of watery food such as broth.
The period of a transitory breeze.
An interval of good weather.
The loose part of a rope; slack.
The property of being infallible; the ability to never make a mistake.
A substance that acts as a cure.
Possessing the ability to cure, to heal or treat illness.
definitions.example: The curative power of the antibiotics introduced in the 1950s was amazing at the time.

definitions.definition: (grammar) of a verb, conveying the meaning "the agent makes a patient do something"
A room attached to an athletic, recreational, or workplace facility, filled with lockers for storage of clothing and equipment; clothes are generally changed there.
definitions.example: We changed into our swimsuits in the locker room next to the pool.

definitions.definition: Characteristic of conversations held in locker rooms; that is, either very informal, boastful, juvenile, or explicitly sexual.
definitions.example: The others tired of Frank's habitual locker-room boasting about various women he had "scored" with

definitions.definition: Slang term for inhalants.
Expressed in silence; implied, but not made explicit; silent.
definitions.example: tacit consent : consent by silence, or by not raising an objection

definitions.definition: Not derived from formal principles of reasoning; based on induction rather than deduction.
(of a person) Having a pleasing appearance or manner; attractive; handsome; friendly; amiable.
Enabled to maintain pleas in court.
Having capacity to take anything granted.
A plane figure bounded by edges that are all straight lines.
The boundary of such a figure.
(more generally) A figure comprising vertices and (not necessarily straight) edges, alternatingly.
Such a figure and its interior, taken as a whole.
A plastic card, usually with a magnetic strip or an embedded microchip, connected to a credit account and used to buy goods or services.
(law enforcement) An officer of the court, particularly:
A public administrator, particularly:
A private administrator, particularly
Any debt collector, regardless of his or her official status.
Having a stiff neck; suffering from torticollis
Stubborn and arrogant.
White, whitish, or greyish-white.
White or grey with age.
definitions.example: The old man bowed his hoary head in acquiescence.

definitions.definition: Of a pale silvery grey.
Covered with short, dense, greyish white hairs; canescent.
Remote in time past.
Moldy; mossy; musty.
Old or old-fashioned.
The crew that maintains aircraft on the ground.
A spar projecting over the prow of a sailing vessel to provide the means of adding sail surface.
A word or phrase in a language formed by word-for-word or morpheme-by-morpheme translation of a word in another language.
definitions.example: The word "watershed" is a calque of the German "Wasserscheide".

definitions.definition: To adopt (a word or phrase) from one language to another by semantic translation of its parts.
The support and monitoring of critically ill patients, especially by the use of instrumentation and specialized staff and equipment.
A hospital ward into which critically ill patients, in danger of dying, are admitted and closely monitored (abbreviation: ICU).
A reference book, published annually.
A publication compiled by the graduating class of a high school or college, recording the year's events and containing photographs of students and faculty.
A school subject in which students learn journalistic skills by compiling a yearbook.
An acute infectious disease of herbivores, especially sheep and cattle, caused by Bacillus anthracis.

The human disease that can occur in humans through contact with infected herbivores, tissue from infected animals, or high concentrations of anthrax spores, but is not usually spread between humans, with symptoms including lesions on the skin or in the lungs, often fatal.
A period of economic crisis in which credit and investment capital are difficult to obtain.
Such a house.
Of a house: joined to another one on one side, having one shared wall.
The tenure of property held in fee simple for life.
An estate held by a tenure of this type.
To dispense property in this way.
A machine for washing dishes.
Someone who washes dishes, especially one hired to wash dishes in a restaurant.
A European bird, the wagtail.
A bird, the restless flycatcher (Myiagra inquieta).
Dangerous, full of peril.
A long time; the long term; an extended period.
definitions.example: I thought it would be a short project, but now it looks like I'm in it for the long haul.

definitions.definition: A long distance
(usually hyphenated) Travelling a long distance.
definitions.example: a long-haul flight

definitions.definition: A tree or shrub of the genus Corylus, bearing edible nuts called hazelnuts or filberts.
The nut of the hazel tree.
The wood of a hazelnut tree.
A greenish-brown colour, the colour of a ripe hazelnut.
Freestone
Of a greenish-brown colour. (often used to refer to eye colour)
A tote bag.
A heavy burden.
(logistics) A kind of plastic box used for transporting goods.
To carry or bear.
definitions.example: to tote a child over a stream

definitions.definition: To add up; to calculate a total.
A pari-mutuel machine; a totalizator.
Pari-mutuel betting.
A stone coffin, often inscribed or decorated with sculpture.
The cement and steel structure that encases the destroyed reactor at the power station in Chernobyl, Ukraine.
A kind of limestone used by the Greeks for coffins, so called because it was thought to consume the flesh of corpses.
An 18th-century form of wine cooler.
The act of preserving peace, specifically between hostile groups or states, especially by a sanctioned military force.
(as a noun modifier) (for example) a peacekeeping force.
A flag normally used by naval vessels to represent a special condition.
The winning of a competition, represented by a flag.
definitions.example: The New York Yankees have won the American League pennant far more often than any other team.

definitions.definition: A rope or strap to which a purchase is hooked.
A sandstone between coal measures in parts of South Wales
The act of circumnavigating, or sailing round.
Something or someone that sticks.
One who sticks to something, or does not give up; a stayer.
An adhesive label or decal.
A price tag.
(by extension) The listed price (also sticker price).
definitions.example: When buying a car, know the sticker and the invoice price.

definitions.definition: A cartoonish illustration of a character that represents an emotion or action, often accompanied by text, that may be superimposed on a digital image.
A burr or seed pod that catches in fur or clothing.
That which causes one to stick; that which puzzles or poses.
A wooden strip placed between courses of lumber to allow air circulation (also kiln sticker).
A small wooden rod in an organ which connects (in part) a key and a pallet, so as to communicate motion by pushing.
A brand, label, or company, especially one making and distributing records.
A paster.
To apply one or more stickers to (something)
To mark as the sticker price
Likely to stick; sticking, sticky.
definitions.example: A sticker type of glue. The stickest kind of gum.

definitions.definition: A long, thin cheese-flavoured pastry.
A very large muscular breed of dog of German origin with black fur and tanned markings.
Unable to sustain its own life
A list of wines, usually with a short description, available at e.g. a restaurant or bar.
A person with heart disease.
Heart disease.
A medicine that excites action in the stomach.
Pertaining to the heart.
definitions.example: the cardiac arteries

definitions.definition: Pertaining to the cardia.
Exciting action in the heart, through the medium of the stomach; cordial; stimulant.
A red-colored, ripe, bell or sweet pepper. Unripe peppers of this variety are green and edible but not as sweet.
Spicy pepper.
definitions.example: Crushed red pepper flakes add zest to pizza.

definitions.definition: To fail, to cease to function.
definitions.example: I am afraid my computer will break down if I try to run it at too high a speed.

definitions.definition: To render or to become unstable due to stress, to collapse physically or mentally.
definitions.example: She is back to work now, after she broke down the other day.

definitions.definition: To render or to become weak and ineffective.
definitions.example: His authority and influence over his coordinates broke down gradually.

definitions.definition: To (cause to) decay, to decompose.
definitions.example: Leaves and grass will break down into compost faster if you keep them moist.

definitions.definition: To divide into parts to give more details, to provide a more indepth analysis of.
definitions.example: If you don't understand, ask him to break down the numbers for you.

definitions.definition: To digest.
definitions.example: His stomach took a while to break down his food.

definitions.definition: A location next to the curb
Adjacent to the curb.
definitions.example: Airlines now often limit curbside check-in to select passengers.

definitions.definition: Makeup that is applied to the eyelids and below the eyes to give a darker complexion there.
A gait of a horse between a trot and a gallop, consisting of three beats and a "suspension" phase, where there are no feet on the ground. Also describing this gait on other four legged animals.
A ride on a horse at such speed.
To move at such pace.
To cause to move at a canter; to ride (a horse) at a canter.
One who cants or whines; a beggar.
One who makes hypocritical pretensions to goodness; one who uses canting language.
A sport played in a walled court with a soft rubber ball and bats like tennis racquets.
A soft drink made from a fruit-based concentrate diluted with water.
definitions.example: When I'm thirsty I drink squash; it tastes much nicer than plain water.

definitions.definition: A place or a situation where people have limited space to move.
definitions.example: It's a bit of a squash in this small room.

definitions.definition: Something soft and easily crushed; especially, an unripe pod of peas.
Something unripe or soft.
A sudden fall of a heavy, soft body; also, a shock of soft bodies.
An extremely one-sided, usually short, match.
To beat or press into pulp or a flat mass; to crush.
To compress or restrict (oneself) into a small space; to squeeze.
definitions.example: Somehow, she squashed all her books into her backpack, which was now too heavy to carry.

definitions.definition: To suppress; to force into submission.
A plant and its fruit of any of a few species of the genus Cucurbita, or gourd kind.
Any other similar-looking plant of other genera.
The edible or decorative fruit of these plants, or this fruit prepared as a dish.
definitions.example: We ate squash and green beans.

definitions.definition: Muskrat.

A sensation of dryness in the throat associated with a craving for liquids, produced by deprivation of drink, or by some other cause (such as fear, excitement, etc.) which spots the secretion of the pharyngeal mucous membrane
The condition producing the sensation of thirst.
A want and eager desire (for something); a craving or longing.
definitions.example: a thirst for gold

definitions.definition: Sexual lust
To be thirsty.
(usually followed by "for") To desire vehemently.
definitions.example: I thirst for knowledge and education will sate me.

definitions.definition: On account of; due to, for the purpose of
The electrified rail that runs beside or between train tracks to power electric trains.
(by extension) anything that is dangerous to come into contact with, or is best avoided.
Diligent; persistent.
Identification.
A brief audio or audiovisual sequence serving to identify the broadcaster.
A protocol serving to identify the user of a particular TCP connection, used especially on IRC networks.
Identifier.
A curry made with red meat, traditionally lamb or goat, flavoured with tomato, paprika or chilli
Any of several animals, in suborder Vermilingua, which are noted for eating ants and termites which they catch with their long sticky tongues.
Any of some other unrelated species that feed with ants, including pangolin (scaly anteater), echidna (spiny anteater), aardvark and numbat (banded anteater).
